statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: All the problems in this contest totally bored you. And every time you get bored you like playing with quadratic equations of the form a*X2 + b*X + c = 0. This time you are very curious to know how many real solutions an equation of this type has.

statement.title: Input
statement.content: The first line of input contains an integer number Q, representing the number of equations to follow. Each of the next Q lines contains 3 integer numbers, separated by blanks, a, b and c, defining an equation. The numbers are from the interval [-1000,1000].

statement.title: Output
statement.content: For each of the Q equations, in the order given in the input, print one line containing the number of real solutions of that equation. Print “INF” (without quotes) if the equation has an infinite number of real solutions.

statement.title: Source
statement.content: Politehnica University of Bucharest Local Team Contest 2007
